newsitem.title: USA: Activision acquires stake in game developer.
newsitem.headline: Activision acquires stake in game developer.

text.p: Activision Inc, a video game developer, said on Tuesday it had acquired an equity stake in Titanic Entertainment, a one-year-old game company.

Titanic will develop a personal computer-based strategy game for Activision with full Internet support, marking Activision's first game specifically for play on the Net. Activision retains rights to a sequel or other second title.

"The Internet offers tremendous opportunities, but a successful online game must incorporate design features that offset the technical constraints of the medium today," Bobby Kotick, chief executive, said in a statement.

Titanic was formed by four former employees of Origin Systems, a unit of huge game maker Electronic Arts Inc. While at Origin, they contributed to games such as "Ultima", "Crusader" and "Wing Commander".
